Before the last update my battery would easily last all day and night. I’d even have enough to keep it going until the afternoon. When there is a fault (e.g. fast flashing) with my power walls, the app never reports them. It does report when they or the circuit breaker is switched off.   So, my only indication of a problem is if solar production is under performing, or I do a visual check, which I’m now in the habit of doing every morning.   Is this the way the app is supposed to work? It seems really odd that it doesn’t report faults.

As the title says. I was wearing and just now my watch is at 10% randomly my watch is only about 2 weeks old as well. Just seeing if anyone else is having this problem or if this is normal. This is only my second Apple Watch I’ve owned so still really new in the world.   **Edit** So after what a few people told me what worked for me to fix it was just unpairing my phone and restarted both the phone and watch and repaired it and now it’s back to having amazing battery life if not better!

March of last year I got an alert for a Front Passenger Safety Restraining System Fault. Mobile service replaced the sensor in 30min and told me it was a known issue in my 2019 M3 and if it happened again. They would just swap out the seat. Issue is caused by placing laptop or cellphone on seat. Well today alert returned and I’m being quoted 1.8k to fix. Car no longer has basic warranty.
